vision.label: History
vision.text: Behmand Auditing Institute was established in 1979 and registered under number 2035 in Tehran Companies Registration Office and has been active for about 46 years in the field of inspection and auditing and other financial-related services.

mission.label: Partners and Managers
mission.text:
The total number of institute managers is 24 people, of which 10 are partners of the institute.

The average work experience of partners is about 31 years and the average work experience of other institute managers is over 10 years.

values.label: Values
values.text: Commitment to professional ethics, accuracy and precision, continuous innovation, and long-term relationships with customers are the fundamental values of Behmand Institute.

about.intro: Behmand Auditing Institute was established in December 1979 by the late Asghar Hoshi and registered under number 2035 in the Tehran Companies Registration Office.

founder.name: Late Asghar Hoshi
founder.bio: Asghar Hoshi was born in 1950 in Isfahan. He completed his primary and secondary education at Mofid School and Saadi High School in Isfahan. He continued his university studies in 1969 at the Oil Company Accounting College in Tehran and obtained a master's degree in accounting in 1974. From his student days, he worked at the Deghigh Auditing Institute under professors such as Mr. Shahrokh Behnam and the late Sajadi Nejad, and progressed to the position of management and partnership of the institute. In 1979, in collaboration with other professors, he established Behmand Auditing Institute and managed the institute until the end of his life. Asghar Hoshi was one of the professors of accounting and auditing in the country. He started teaching accounting courses in 1974 at the Higher School of Commerce and continued at Allameh, Alzahra, Shahid Beheshti universities and the Faculty of Economics and Finance. Asghar Hoshi, both at the university and at Deghigh and Behmand institutes, played an effective role in educating and training multiple generations of accounting and auditing students in the country. During this period, as an inspector and auditor, he collaborated with hundreds of large and small companies and public and private institutions and played a role in improving the effective management of these companies and institutions. From 1974 onwards, he was a member of the Iranian Association of Certified Public Accountants, the Association of Chartered Accountants, the Iranian Association of Certified Public Accountants, the Iranian Accounting Association and the Association of Official Experts of the Judiciary, and played an effective role in professional affairs and the development of tax laws. He is considered one of the pioneers and veterans of the accounting and auditing profession in the country. Throughout his life, Asghar Hoshi was an independent person committed to ethical and professional principles, and always placed public interests and professional principles at the forefront of his considerations, thus helping to enhance the role of the independent auditor.

currentPartners.title: Current Institute Partners
currentPartners.description: The current partners of the firm are Mr. Reza Atash, Ali Mashreghi Arani, Hooman Hoshi, Mohammadreza Arzomand Soumehsaraei, Ahmadreza Sharifi Ghazvini, Nader Rostegari, Rasoul Davazdah Emami, Mohammadreza Rahmanian, Sajad Delpak, and Ali Rahmati. Behmand Audit Institute is a member of the Iranian Association of Certified Public Accountants, the Iranian Association of Certified Accountants, and the Iranian Accounting Association, and is also a trusted auditor of the Securities and Exchange Organization, the Central Bank, and the Central Insurance of Iran.

tax.title: Financial and Tax Accounting Services
tax.desc: Tax planning and optimization in compliance with Iranian laws and regulations.
tax.fullDesc: Tax consulting includes analysis of current tax laws, planning for legal tax burden reduction, preparation of tax returns and representation before tax authorities.

legalInspection.title: Legal Inspection
legalInspection.desc: Legal inspection services include detailed examination of financial documents, accounting reports and company performance to ensure activities comply with current country laws and regulations.
legalInspection.fullDesc: Legal inspection is conducted according to Article 148 of the amended Commercial Code and aims to protect the rights of shareholders and stakeholders. In this process, the legal inspector is required to independently review financial statements, contracts and board decisions and provide a transparent and impartial report. This report can include risk assessment, corrective suggestions and analysis of the company's financial system strengths and weaknesses. The result of this inspection is an important tool for management and shareholder decision-making and plays a key role in increasing transparency and public trust.

financialConsulting.title: Financial Management Consulting
financialConsulting.desc: Providing specialized consulting for financial resource optimization, capital productivity increase and economic risk reduction.
financialConsulting.fullDesc: Financial management consulting services include analysis of the organization's current financial situation, design of investment strategies, cash flow management and providing cost reduction solutions. In this process, financial consultants help managers make more informed decisions by carefully examining financial statements, budgeting and economic forecasts. The main goal of these services is to increase profitability, create financial stability and support sustainable business growth. Financial management consulting can also include guidance on project financing, debt management and optimal capital structure design.

liquidation.title: Liquidation Supervision
liquidation.desc: Supervision of liquidation managers' performance and providing transparent reports to the general assembly according to Article 218 of the Commercial Code.
liquidation.fullDesc: According to Article 218 of the amended Commercial Code, the liquidation supervisor is required to supervise all actions and operations of the company's liquidation managers. This supervision includes reviewing documents, contracts and decisions related to the liquidation process to ensure all matters are conducted within the legal framework and for the benefit of stakeholders. Finally, the supervisor must provide a comprehensive and impartial report of the examination results to the company's general assembly to ensure transparency and accountability in the liquidation process.

arbitration.title: Financial Arbitration
arbitration.desc: Resolution of financial and contractual disputes outside the court with an impartial arbitrator's ruling.
arbitration.fullDesc: Financial arbitration is a private and consensual method for resolving financial and contractual disputes that, instead of going to court, is conducted by selecting an impartial arbitrator. In this process, documents, financial reports and contract terms are examined and an enforceable ruling is issued. Advantages of arbitration include greater speed, confidentiality, lower costs and the possibility of selecting a financial expert arbitrator. This approach helps parties resolve disputes with minimal business disruption and maximum certainty.

valuation.title: Stock and Share Valuation
valuation.desc: Determining fair value of stocks and shares using specialized valuation methods.
valuation.fullDesc: Stock and share valuation involves determining the fair value of ownership in joint-stock and non-joint-stock companies based on accepted approaches like income approach (DCF), market comparison approach and cost approach/net asset value. In this process, financial statements, cash flows, capital structure, risks and growth prospects are examined to provide a reliable basis for transactions, capital attraction, partner exit, mergers/acquisitions and dispute resolution. The valuation output is provided as a documented, transparent and reliable report.
